message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.NE, cs.AI, cs.CV

The paper proposes a novel method for regularizing RNNs, which is a common topic in machine learning and specifically in natural language processing. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper focuses on language modeling tasks, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.CL (Computation and Language). The method proposed involves stochasticity and preserving hidden activations, which are common techniques in neural networks, suggesting that it could also belong to cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper achieves state-of-the-art results on permuted sequential MNIST, which is a computer vision task, indicating that it could also belong to cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition).
